item.title: Analysing Outliers
item.description: Outlier is a value that does not follow the usual norms of the data. For almost all the statistical methods, outliers present a particular challenge, and so it becomes crucial to identify and treat them. Let’s see which all packages and functions can be used in R to deal with outliers. Overview The presence of outliers in the dataset can be a result of an error, or it can be a real value present in the data as a result of the actual distribution of the data.
